tool.name: OSP candidates
tool.description: constructs a putative list of potential o-spanin from an input genomic FASTA

param.label: Range Selection; default is all; for a specific range to check for a spanin input integers separated by a colon (eg. 1234:4321)
param.name: switch

param.label: Lipobox minimal distance from start codon
param.name: osp_min_dist

param.label: Lipobox maximum distance from start codon
param.name: osp_max_dist
param.help: Searches for a Lipobox between Lipoboxmin and Lipoboxmax ie [Lipoboxmin,Lipoboxmax]

param.label: Minimum amount of residues after lipobox is found
param.name: lipo_min

param.label: Maximum amount of residues after lipobox is found
param.name: lipo_max

tool.help:
*NOTE: This tool only takes a SINGLE genomic fasta. It does not work with multiFASTAs.*
**INPUT** --> Genomic FASTA
**METHODOLOGY**
Locates ALL potential start sequences, based on ttg / atg / gtg (M / L / V). This generates a set of output files consisting of FASTA (nt and aa) / BED (hidden) / GFF3 (hidden).
With the aaFASTA, this tool reads in each potential sequence and determines if it has a lipobox based off of:
1. Min distance from start codon to lipobox 2. Max distance from start codon to lipobox
Within that minimum and maximum range, a regular expression (RegEx) is used to determine if a lipobox is found. If so, it is added to a candidate list, and eventually ported to a file in the output.
**OUTPUT** --> putative_osp.fa (FASTA) file, putative_osp.gff3, and basic summary statistics file as sumamry_osp.txt
